00048 class KVILIB_API KviConfig : public KviHeapObject
00049 {
00050 public:
00051         enum FileMode { Read = 1 , Write = 2 , ReadWrite = 3 };
00052 public:
00053         KviConfig(const QString &filename,FileMode f/* = ReadWrite*/,bool bLocal8Bit = false);
00054         KviConfig(const char *filename,FileMode f/* = ReadWrite*/,bool bLocal8Bit = false);
00055         ~KviConfig();
00056 private:
00057         bool                         m_bLocal8Bit;
00058         KviPointerHashTable<QString,KviConfigGroup>      * m_pDict;
00059         QString                      m_szFileName;
00060         bool                         m_bDirty;
00061         QString                      m_szStrBuffer;
00062         QString                      m_szGroup;
00063         bool                         m_bPreserveEmptyGroups;
00064         bool                         m_bReadOnly;
00065 private:
00066         bool load();
00067         bool save();
00068         KviConfigGroup * getCurrentGroup();
00069 public:
00070         //
00071         // Useful when saving...
00072         // Normally this class does not save empty groups
00073         // and setGroup() is never a config modification.
00074         // If the group is not existing it will be effectively
00075         // created only at the first attempt to read from it or write to it.
00076         // With this flag set to true the KviConfig class will
00077         // write down also the empty groups , and calls to setGroup()
00078         // will create the groups if not existing yet (and set the config data
00079         // as modified).
00080         //
00081         void preserveEmptyGroups(bool bPreserve){ m_bPreserveEmptyGroups = bPreserve; };
00082         const QString & fileName(){ return m_szFileName; };
00083         bool readOnly(){ return m_bReadOnly; };
00084         void setReadOnly(bool bReadOnly){ m_bReadOnly = bReadOnly; };
00085         bool dirty(){ return m_bDirty; };
00086         //
00087         // This sets the save path for the config file
00088         // In this way you can load a system-wide read-only config file
00089         // as default configuration, alter its settings and save it to the
00090         // user local configuration directory
00091         void setSavePath(const QString & savePath){ m_szFileName = savePath; };
00092         KviPointerHashTable<QString,KviConfigGroup> *dict(){ return m_pDict; };
00093 
00094         void clearDirtyFlag(){ m_bDirty = false; };
00095         void clear();
00096         void clearGroup(const QString & szGroup);
00097         void clearKey(const QString & szKey);
00098         unsigned int groupsCount(){ return m_pDict->count(); };
00099         bool sync(){ return save(); };
00100         bool hasKey(const QString & szKey);
00101         bool hasGroup(const QString & szGroup);
00102         void setGroup(const QString & szGroup);
00103         //void getContentsString(KviStr &buffer);
00104         const QString & group(){ return m_szGroup; };
00105         void writeEntry(const QString & szKey,const QString & szValue);
00106         void writeEntry(const QString & szKey,const char * szValue)
00107                 { writeEntry(szKey,QString::fromUtf8(szValue)); };
00108         QString readEntry(const QString & szKey,const QString & szDefault = QString());
00109         // HACK for KviOptions.. (FIXME)
00110         QString readKviStrEntry(const QString &szKey,const KviStr &szDefault)
00111                 { return readEntry(szKey,szDefault.ptr()); };

00113         //const char * readEntry(const char *szKey,KviStr &szDefault);

00151 #ifdef COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS
00152         // On windows we need to override new and delete operators
00153         // to ensure that always the right new/delete pair is called for an object instance
00154         // This bug is present in all the classes exported by a module that
00155         // can be instantiated/destroyed from external modules.
00156         // (this is a well known bug described in Q122675 of MSDN)
00157         void       * operator new(size_t tSize);
00158         void         operator delete(void * p);
00159 #endif
